meanings.definition: The arrangement of leaves in a bud before they unfold.
meanings.sent1: In spring, the tight vernation of the rose buds slowly gave way to beautiful blooming flowers.
meanings.sent2: The botanist studied the vernation of various plant species to understand their growth patterns.
meanings.sent3: The impatient squirrel tried to speed up the vernation of the tree buds by blowing on them.
meanings.sent4: The vernation of the tightly packed leaves in the bud was like a secret waiting to be revealed.
meanings.sent5: The intricate vernation of the fern fronds fascinated the nature enthusiasts on their hike.

meanings.definition: The way in which leaves are arranged in a bud.
meanings.sent1: The intricate vernation of the lily bud caught the gardener's eye.
meanings.sent2: Botanists use microscopes to study the vernation of tiny leaf buds.
meanings.sent3: The playful breeze messed up the vernation of the tulip buds, making them look like a messy puzzle.
meanings.sent4: The vernation of the leaves in the bud resembled a tightly packed gift waiting to be opened.
meanings.sent5: The perfect vernation of the cherry blossom buds signaled the arrival of spring.
